Package com.ubicua.didas.authentication

Class DidasUserAuthenticator

java.lang.Object
org.keycloak.authentication.authenticators.browser.WebAuthnAuthenticator
com.ubicua.didas.authentication.DidasUserAuthenticator
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.keycloak.authentication.Authenticator, org.keycloak.authentication.CredentialValidator<org.keycloak.credential.WebAuthnCredentialProvider>, org.keycloak.provider.Provider
public class DidasUserAuthenticator extends org.keycloak.authentication.authenticators.browser.WebAuthnAuthenticator
Custom authenticator for WebAuthn-based user authentication with additional vehicle-based access control.

Extends Keycloak's WebAuthnAuthenticator to:

  • Present a WebAuthn challenge to the user.
  • Process the WebAuthn response and validate credentials.
  • Enforce a custom 'userVehicle' attribute check against the current client to restrict access per vehicle.

Lifecycle

  1. authenticate(org.keycloak.authentication.AuthenticationFlowContext) is invoked to render the WebAuthn login form and issue the challenge.
  2. action(org.keycloak.authentication.AuthenticationFlowContext) is invoked on form submission to parse and validate the response, perform vehicle validation via validateUserVehicle(org.keycloak.authentication.AuthenticationFlowContext, java.lang.String, org.keycloak.models.UserModel), and succeed or fail the flow.
  3. close() is a no-op cleanup hook.
Author:
Ivan Kuchumov

    • validateUserVehicle

      private void validateUserVehicle(org.keycloak.authentication.AuthenticationFlowContext context, String client_idFromUri, org.keycloak.models.UserModel user)
      Validates that the user's stored 'userVehicle' attribute matches the current client. If not, issues an ACCESS_DENIED response.
      Parameters:
      context - current flow context
      client_idFromUri - client identifier from request
      user - authenticated user model
      Throws:
      org.keycloak.authentication.AuthenticationFlowException - always thrown to halt the flow on access denied

    • getCredentialType

      protected String getCredentialType()
      Determines which WebAuthn credential type to use and applies custom vehicle-based authorization checks before returning the type.

      Steps performed:

      1. Reads the 'username' form parameter and retrieves the corresponding user.
      2. Extracts 'client_id' from the request URI and finds the matching client.
      3. If the client has the HOLDER_ROLE, checks that the user's 'userVehicle' attribute matches the client ID; if not, records an access-denied event and throws AuthenticationFlowException to abort the flow.

      Overrides:
      getCredentialType in class org.keycloak.authentication.authenticators.browser.WebAuthnAuthenticator
      Returns:
      the static WebAuthn credential type identifier ("webauthn") if access is permitted
      Throws:
      org.keycloak.authentication.AuthenticationFlowException - if the user isn't authorized for the client/vehicle

    • setErrorResponse

      private void setErrorResponse(org.keycloak.authentication.AuthenticationFlowContext context, String errorCase, String errorMessage)
      Issues an error form response and logs the event.
      Parameters:
      context - flow context
      errorCase - error key for messages
      errorMessage - detailed message (may be null)
